soar.gui.plotWindow¶

Tkinter wrapper for plotting using matplotlib

class soar.gui.plotWindow.PlotWindow(title='Plotting Window', visible=True, toplevel=<class 'tkinter.Toplevel'>)¶

Bases: matplotlib.figure.Figure

Tk window containing a matplotlib plot. In addition to the functions described below, also supports all functions contained in matplotlib’s Axes and Figure objects.

clear()¶

Clear the plot, keeping the Tk window active

destroy()¶

Destroy the Tk window. Note that after calling this method (or manually closing the Tk window), this PlotWindow cannot be used.

legend(*args)¶

Create a legend for the figure (requires plots to have been made with labels)

makeWindow()¶

Pack the plot and matplotlib toolbar into the containing Tk window (called by initializer; you will probably never need to use this).

save(fname)¶

Save this plot as an image. File type determined by extension of filename passed in. See documentation for savefig.

Parameters:fname – The name of the file to create.
show()¶

Update the canvas image (automatically called for most functions)

stay()¶

Start the Tkinter window’s main loop (e.g., to keep the plot open at the end of the execution of a script)

title(title)¶

Change the title of the Tk window

soar.gui.plotWindow.reafter()¶
